results.title: The Knowledge of healing
results.creator_credit: Franz Reichle, Marcel Hoehn and T&C Film AG
results.brief_description: The Knowledge of Healing is the first feature length documentary dealing with Tibetan medicine. Originally recorded in Gyushi, “The Knowledge of Healing” is a medical manual written in the 12th century. Its text describes one of the most highly developed, holistic approaches to medicine, comprising its own pharmacopoeia of herbs, roots and minerals. The film explains the text through case studies of patients progressing under treatment for ailments and conditions deemed incurable in the West. The film also contains interviews with two leading Tibetan physicians as well as H.H. The Dalai Lama. In Tibetan, Russian, German and Buryat with English subtitles.

results.title: The Knock at the door
results.creator_credit: Helen Raw, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: War has followed Helen all her life. As a young girl, she wrote letters to her brothers overseas and she had feared losing her husband in the Vietnam war. That dreaded knock on the door was something she never wanted to hear.

results.title: The Kiss
results.brief_description: Greta Garbo plays a woman accused of adultery and the murder of her husband. Set with a pre-talkies soundtrack this early film of Garbo’s highlights early European conservatism and the impact of social scandal on a young woman determined to maintain her dignity and freedom to follow true love. This collector’s classic edition of the film also features Garbo career highlights including rare fashion show footage, screen-tests and the star’s arrival in the USA.

results.title: The Kiss
results.brief_description: Sue and Bob haven’t had sex in ages, much to the chagrin of Sue (Zoe Carides), but not Bob (Peter Brown), who would rather spend time fixing the car. Bob gets more than he bargained for when his gay, next door neighbour (Hugo Weaving) offers to assist in the car’s repair. (Awards: Winner Best Comedy and Best Score, TropFest Film Festival, 1998)

results.title: The King: Wayne Carey
results.creator_credit: Stephen Phillips and Visual Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: There is no more influential or imposing figure in football today than the Kangaroos captain; Wayne Carey. Voted as the greatest player of the twentieth century by Leigh Matthews, Carey has stamped his mark as the dominant centre half forward of his era in over 200 games. All Australian captain, quadruple club champion, leading goalkicker, Carey has earned himself the worthy reputation of “King”. In this program Carey reflects on the memorable moments of his career, there are also revealing interviews with coach Denis Pagan as well as team mates and opponents.

results.title: The King who loved his family
results.brief_description: A film of historical interest showing many of the less well known photographs of events in the life of the late King George VI. Made on the occassion of his death, the film is a tribute to a man and his family. Includes the funeral procession of King George’s grandfather; the ‘Spreading Chestnut Tree’ game in which the King participated at a holiday camp; the King yachting with his father; the visit to Australia; shipboard games en route to South Africa; an early visit to France; extracts from the abdication speech of King Edward.

results.title: The King of New York
results.creator_credit: Abel Ferrara, Vittorio Squillante, Mary Kane and Reteitalia
results.brief_description: Christopher Walken stars as a drug lord turned good guy in this crime film directed by Abel Ferrara. Frank White is released from prison, a reformed man and sets out to take over New York City, in order to prevent the closure of a hospital in the South Bronx where he grew up. With the help of a few gangster friends, he begins to take over the entire drug industry in the city, killing those standing in his way. As his takeover begins to succeed he brings in more recruits, but unknowingly starts a underground war between crime groups in the city. Cast also includes Larry Fishburne, Wesley Snipes, David Caruso and Steve Buscemi.
